intro: Luvunga minutiflora, commonly known as the small-flowered luvunga, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its tiny, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and less-studied species.
